newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS -- Issues to watch - March 20.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS -- Issues to watch - March 20.

text.p: * Intel Corp, which fell 3-3/8 to 133-3/8 during regular trading hours, continued its decline after the bell Wednesday, slipping to 132-7/8, traders said.
* Avant! Corp fell one point to 25-3/4 after the close. Avant! had gained two points during regular trading hours.
* SpeedFam International Inc rose to 34-1/4 from 33 in after-hours trade following release of its third-quarter results.

* Boeing Co was up 3/4 to 104-3/4 in London after a Wall Street Journal report said Delta Air Lines Inc and Boeing would announce a long-term pact for the airline to buy all of its planes from Boeing.
* First Bank System Inc and U.S. Bancorp said they had agreed to merge in a deal worth $9 billion. First Bank closed at 78-1/4 while U.S. Bancorp closed at 48-1/4.
* AMR Corp's American Airlines and negotiators from its pilots union reached tentative agreement on a new contract, the union said. AMR closed at 84-5/8.

* Portland General Corp said it and Enron Corp were informed by a senior member of the Oregon Public Utility Commission that commission staff had decided to recommend disapproval of the companies' merger plan.
Portland General closed at 37-1/8. Enron closed at 39-1/8.
